[SPELLING]: Repeated use of "stuff" as a placeholder (e.g., "a city, bearing the name stuff")
[GRAMMAR]: Missing comma after introductory phrase in "the great high road -- joining K'ou-li [...] has in North Kansu an E-W direction"
Awkward placement of "however" in "changed however the mental atmosphere"
Dangling modifier in "having tails, whom the Chinese call Kuzurkei"
Dangling modifier in "built and furnished in Chinese style"

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition from landscape description to the Yögur village
Disjointed ending with abrupt shift to house descriptions and local administration
[CLARITY]: Unclear references to "stuff" (used as a placeholder for names/locations)
Ambiguous reference to "a thing" in "escaped a contagious disease [...] to escape a thing"
[LOGIC]: Confusing legend about the city and tribe’s migration due to missing context
[TRANSITION]: Jumps between topics (temple, lamas, administrative details) without smooth connections

[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "using their own legs and heels as seats"
Unclear clause in "as the thing and Mongolians wear it"

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from head-dress descriptions to Yögur clothing practices
[STRUCTURE]: Disjointed transition between women’s attire and Sarö Yögur’s lack of holiday attire
[LOGIC]: Sudden jump from basket-making to cloth sales without connecting ideas
